title.narrative: Green Urban Financing and Innovation Project

description.narrative: The project development objective is to increase access to sustainable, long-term financing for selected green urban investments benefitting local governments in the Yangtze River Delta Region.

participating-org.narrative: International Bank for Reconstruction and Development
International Bank for Reconstruction and Development
Shanghai Green Urban Financing and Services Co., Ltd (FSC)

condition.narrative: Action Plan for Bond IssuancePA, Schedule, Section IV.2: FSC shall by no later than December 31, 2020, prepare an Action Planfor Bond Issuance, in form and substance acceptable to the Bank, and thereafter implement said plan, in a manner acceptable to theBank, with the objective of issuing a green bond (as such term is understood in accordance with international best practices,acceptable to the Bank) by March 31, 2025 (or such other date agreed with the Bank).

Annual Work PlansPA, Schedule, Section I.C.1: FSC shall: (a) prepare and furnish to the Bank by December 1 in each year,beginning in 2019, a draft Annual Work Plan for review and comment, summarizing the implementation progress of the Project for thesaid year and the Project activities to be undertaken in the following calendar year, including the proposed annual budget for theProject; (b) taking into account the Bank's comments, finalize and furnish to the Bank no later than January 1 in each year,beginning in 2020, the Annual Work Plan, satisfactory to the Bank; and (c) thereafter ensure the implementation of the Projectduring the following calendar year in accordance with the Annual Work Plan agreed with the Bank and in a manner satisfactory to theBank. FSC shall not amend, suspend, abrogate, or waive said Annual Work Plans or any provision thereof without the prior writtenagreement of the Bank.

Equity ContributionPA, Schedule, Section IV.1: Shanghai Chengtou shall promptly take, on terms and conditions acceptable to theBank, all actions as shall be necessary to provide at least RMB 1,500,000,000 to support the operations of FSC, which funding shallbe provided through Shanghai Chengtou's subscription for paid-in equity capital of FSC in accordance with a schedule of paymentplan acceptable to the Bank, as said plan may be revised from time to time with the prior written agreement of the Bank.

FI Due DiligencePA, Schedule, Section IV.3: (a) FSC shall by no later than June 30, 2020 carry out jointly with the Bank, areview to assess the performance and capacity of FSC. Such review shall include an assessment of FSC's financial performance,business practices, operational capacity, governance structure, portfolio, as well as any other issue as may be requested by theBank, and identify measures, acceptable to the Bank, aimed at ensuring that FSC's performance and capacity remain adequate for theefficient completion of the Project and to further the objectives thereof. (b) FSC shall: (i) provide to the Bank all suchinformation as the Bank shall reasonably request for the purposes of the aforementioned review; and (ii) promptly implement themeasures identified by the aforementioned review in a manner acceptable to the Bank.

Green Infrastructure Sub-projectsPA, Schedule, Section I.D: For the purpose of carrying out Parts 1 and 2 of the Project, FSCshall: (a) select and approve Eligible Sub-borrowers and Entrusted Banks in accordance with the eligibility criteria and theprocedures set forth in the Business Plan and the Project Operations Manual; (b) enter into appropriate agreements or arrangementswith the Entrusted Banks for the purpose of facilitating the extension of Sub-loans or FSC Sub-loans on terms and conditionsacceptable to the Bank; (c) appraise, review, approve, and supervise the Green Infrastructure Sub-projects in accordance with thecriteria, conditions and procedures set out in the Business Plan and the Project Operations Manual; and (d) make Sub-loans or FSCSub-loans to Eligible Sub-borrowers in accordance with eligibility criteria and procedures acceptable to the Bank as set out in theBusiness Plan and the Project Operations Manual, and shall only make the proceeds of the Sub-loan available to such EligibleSub-borrower after FSC and the Entrusted Bank, as may be required, have entered into a Sub-loan Agreement with the EligibleSub-borrower on terms and conditions acceptable to the Bank.FSC shall: (a) exercise its rights under each Sub-loan Agreement insuch manner as to protect the interests of the Borrower, the Bank and FSC and to accomplish the purposes of the Loan; and (b)maintain, throughout the period of implementation of the Project, a grievance redress mechanism acceptable to the Bank and set outin the Project Operations Manual, to address any complaints associated with the Sub-loans. Except as the Borrower and the Bankshall otherwise agree, FSC shall not assign, amend, abrogate or waive any Sub-loan Agreement, or any of their provisions.

Institutional Arrangements (General)Project Agreement (PA), Schedule, Section I.A.1: In order to ensure the proper carrying outof the Project, FSC shall maintain throughout the period of implementation of the Project an organizational structure under thedirection of qualified management provided with sufficient resources, and staffed with competent personnel in adequate numbersincluding dedicated departments focusing on the management of the Loan proceeds (including environmental and social safeguards),financial management, investment business, compliance and risk management, and integrated management, in each case withqualifications, experience and under terms of reference acceptable to the Bank.

Mid-term ReviewPA, Schedule, Section II.2: FSC shall prepare, under terms of reference satisfactory to the Bank, and furnish tothe Bank no later than June 30, 2023, a consolidated mid-term review report for the Project, summarizing the results of themonitoring and evaluation activities carried out from the inception of the Project, and setting out the measures recommended toensure the efficient completion of the Project and to further the objectives thereof.

Project Operations ManualPA, Schedule, Section I.C.2: Throughout the implementation of the Project, FSC shall apply the ProjectOperations Manual in a timely and efficient manner satisfactory to the Bank. FSC shall not amend, suspend, or waive said ProjectOperations Manual or any provision or schedule thereof, without the prior written agreement of the Bank. In the event of anyinconsistency between the provisions of the Project Operations Manual and those of this Agreement or the Loan Agreement, theprovisions of this Agreement and the Loan Agreement shall prevail.

SafeguardsPA, Schedule, Section I.E: The Project Implementing Entity shall implement, and shall cause the the EligibleSub-borrowers to: (a) implement, the Safeguards Instruments in a manner and substance acceptable to the Bank; (b) ensure that eachcontract for works financed under the Project includes the obligations of the work contractors and any sub-contractor to complywith the relevant provisions of the Safeguards Instruments, as the case may be; (c) ensure that all studies and technicalassistance to be supported under the Project are carried out under terms of reference acceptable to the Bank, and that such termsof reference are consistent with, and pay due attention to, the Bank's Safeguards Policies; (d) not amend, suspend, or waive theSafeguards Instruments, or any provision thereof, without the prior written concurrence of the Bank; (e) maintain, policies andprocedures adequate to enable them to monitor and evaluate, in accordance with guidelines acceptable to the Bank, theimplementation of the Safeguards Instruments; and (f) take all measures necessary on their part to regularly collect, compile, andsubmit to the Bank, as part of the Project Reports, and promptly in a separate report whenever the circumstances warrant,information on the status of compliance with the Safeguards Instruments.

Subsidiary Loan AgreementPA, Schedule, Section I.B: To facilitate the carrying out of the Project, Shanghai shall make theproceeds of the Loan available to FSC under a subsidiary agreement between Shanghai and FSC, under terms and conditions acceptableto the Bank (“Subsidiary Loan Agreement”). Shanghai shall exercise its rights under the Subsidiary Loan Agreement in such manner asto protect the interests of Shanghai, the Borrower and the Bank and to accomplish the purposes of the Loan. Except as the Bankshall otherwise agree, Shanghai shall not assign, amend, abrogate or waive the Subsidiary Loan Agreement or any of its provisions.
